page.title: 15Health Care - East Leicester
page.content: {Leicester General Hospital:}Opened in 1905 as North Evington Poor Law Infirmary at a cost of Â£75,575 with 512 beds.Today it has a nurses training school & is the teaching hospital for Leicester University School of Medicine. It is administered by the Trent Regional Board,has 1024 beds,400 flats & 38 houses for staff. Departments include: Medical,Surgical, Maternity,Renal,Coronary Care, Othopoedic,Geriatrics,Neo-Natal,Out- Patients & Dis-ability Unit. {Access Bus Service}in Leicester aims to transport as many handicapped people as possible from the area to the city centre,in specially converted buses carrying 34 passengers & 3 wheel chairs at 5p a time. The scheme was inaugurated by Mrs.M.Cotterell of Evington,who is disabled herself.
